result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayvon M Blain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Give False Alarm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.13.
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court had 240 days available based on the revocation order and warrant, this would allow Mr Blain to argue for the additional credit to be applied to a different case.

[MA]Case called at 2:39pm 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court is having difficulty obtaining video connection with Mr. Blain

The Court proposes imposing a time served sentence

Competency Evaluation has been submitted

The Court sentences Mr. Blain to 8 months jail on each count, concurrent to each other and any other sentence in being

The Court gives 180 days credit, for a time served sentence

The Court had 240 days available based on the revocation order and warrant, this would allow Mr Blain to argue for the additional credit to be applied to a different case. 

Any outstanding costs, fees, surcharges are to be reduced to civil judgement.

[MA]Case 16CM50 called at 2:04pm
Defendant Trayvon M Blain in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Atty. De La Rosa's Letter raising competency:
--DA Happ has no objection to the Court using report in 18CF11,if able
--the Court orders competency evaluation be conducted

As to Case 18CF11:
--Atty. De La Rosa has no objection to the Court conducting the competency hearing on Case 18CF11 today
--DA Happ and Atty. De La Rosa agree with the opinion of the doctors report
--Mr. Blain does not object to the findings in the report
--Based upon the Doctor's report, recommendations of both DA Happ and Attorney De La Rosa, the Court finds and declares Mr. Blain not competent to assist in his defense at this time, but likely to regain competency.
--the Court finds the Mr. Blain is not competent to refuse medication or treatment and Mr. Blain should be treated on a inpatient basis

The Competency Hearing scheduled for Thursday can be cancelled, as to Case 18CF11

recess: 2:11pm
NEXT: Competency Hearing to be scheduled in Case 16CM50 (Court will include date in Order)
regarding Mr. Blain's competency to proceed with sentencing today

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 16CM50 & 16CM164 called together at 10:53 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for FSSC & MH)
Defendant Trayvon M Blain in court, in-custody, with Attorney David Kennedy Anderson. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2 & #3-16CM50; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 16CM164 & Count #1-16CM50

16CM50, Counts #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--No presence at or be 1000 feet within Jordan apartments in Fort Atkinson
--No acts/threats of violence
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay restitution of $125, payable to Nicholas Jordan
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 35 days
Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation under 973.015 
Recess: 11:20 am
Motion hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Trayvon M Blain
Current: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2016)

made by the Defense on this date

Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake: 
[MK] cases #16CM50 and #16CM164 called at 1:49pm. 
Defendant Trayvon M Blain appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Blain remains homeless; he has no mailing address.
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial requested by the Defense.

In Case #16CM50, the Court requires a $250 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no presence at 218 N. Main Street in Fort Atkinson
--no discussion of the facts of the case wtih Marcus Blain

In Case #16 CM 164, the Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond 
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person 
--no discussion of the facts of the case wtih Brandon Blain
--no contact with Adam Schaller, Kelly Vance, or Debi Adcox 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

The Court informs Mr. Blain of his right to counsel, in the event that he loses eligibility for PD counsel or wishes to hire private counsel. 
The Court indicates that it is quashing the Warrants in these cases 
recess 1:57pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/4/16 at 9:00am   (2) FSSC on 5/31/16 at 10:30am (3) Jury Trial on 6/6-6/7/16 at 8:30am--speedy trial time limits pend
